homes_hear_details: Oklahoma has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Oklahoma Department of Commerce - Division of Community Affairs and Development is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy.
state_energy_office: Oklahoma Department of Commerce - Division of Community Affairs and Development

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Oklahoma, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Oklahoma County (Oklahoma City), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $58,150. In Tulsa County, it is approximately $57,900.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Oklahoma, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Oklahoma County (Oklahoma City), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $109,050. In Tulsa County, it is approximately $108,600.

net_metering: Oklahoma adopted a net metering policy that applies to systems up to 100 kW for residential customers. However, in 2014, Oklahoma passed legislation allowing utilities to charge a fixed monthly surcharge to distributed generation customers. The Oklahoma Corporation Commission sets specific rates that may include demand charges for solar customers.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $6,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across Oklahoma.

programs.name: OG&E Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $250 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, insulation, duct sealing

programs.name: OG&E Home Energy Efficiency Audit
programs.eligible_items: Home energy evaluation identifying savings opportunities

programs.name: PSO Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $150 for smart thermostats, $200 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, insulation, duct sealing, ENERGY STAR windows

programs.name: Residential Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $400 for high-efficiency furnaces, $200 for water heaters
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency natural gas furnaces, tankless water heaters, smart thermostats
